content.question: Saltwater intrusion is a growing problem in places in the United States including in the coastal cities of Savannah, Georgia, Cape May, New Jersey, and Tampa Bay, Florida. Which of the following is the most likely cause of saltwater intrusion into freshwater municipal wells in these cities located near the coastline?

choices.label: Destruction of forests, which increases the amount of sediment entering ocean water
Increase in impervious surfaces, which increases groundwater pollution
Changes in atmospheric carbon dioxide concentration, which change the <math overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>pH</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> of ocean water
Urbanization and population growth, which lead to overpumping from aquifers

content.answer: Urbanization and population growth, which lead to overpumping from aquifers

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
